etymology.description: 高(高) (gāo, "high"), 麗(麗) (lì, "beautiful"), 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable")
etymology.interpretation: 高麗(高麗) (gāolí, "Korea") refers historically to the Goryeo dynasty in Korea, known for its cultural influence in ancient times. 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable") indicates this is a type of vegetable. Thus, 高丽菜(高麗菜) (gāolícài) means 'Korean vegetable,' which is how cabbage is referred to in some regions, especially Taiwan.

examples.chinese: 我很喜欢吃高丽菜(我很喜歡吃高麗菜)。
今天市场上有很多新鲜的高丽菜(今天市場上有很多新鮮的高麗菜)，我们打算买一些回家做菜(我們打算買一些回家做菜)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shìchǎng shàng yǒu hěn duō xīnxiān de gāolícài, wǒmen dǎsuàn mǎi yīxiē huíjiā zuò cài.
examples.english: There are many fresh cabbages at the market today, and we plan to buy some to cook at home.

examples.chinese: 妈妈常常用高丽菜(媽媽常常用高麗菜)，做一锅清汤(做一鍋清湯)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā chángcháng yòng gāolícài, zuò yī guō qīngtāng.
examples.english: Mom often uses cabbage to make a pot of clear soup.
